title: (x) Toptunet CV - mdd (e-Types) {Mike F, Jan Sandvik}
content:
Could anybody please help me with this one?   
Thanks in advance...   
   
 ![another sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141524im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/22016.gif)
author: nicolai

comments.content:
This looks familiar...   
Where did you get the sample?   
I mean, there's a huge gap between 'T' and 'o'...

The sample is from a danish magazine called Moment and   
is written for students at various educations all over the country.   
   
Would you like me to post another sample?   
If so, please specify which characters youï¿½d like to see
The closest font I could find in my Sans Serif ID Guide was [Agfa's 'Zemestro'](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141524/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=406022).

Here are some caps and numerals...   
 ![another sans2](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141524im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/22075.gif)

The the name of the company is actually Moment A/S   
   
All I can give you is a couple of names from the colophon   
and [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141524/http:/www.moment.dk/Kommunikation/indhold.aspx?action=navigate&pageid=81) link. Whoever designed the magazine should do   
something about the (lack of) website...   
   
At first glance the typeface made me think of some of the   
work made by [Kontrapunkt](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141524/http:/www.kontrapunkt.dk/flash.html) or [e-Types](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141524/http:/www.e-types.dk/Default_uk.asp?artikelID=11&nav=&print=)...   
   
I can post more samples, but not much more info... ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141524im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/sad.gif)
Articles from the magazine can be read online at [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141524/http:/www.studenterhjaelpen.dk/moment/default.asp) site.

Nicolai,   
I followed your e-types link out of curiosity and their [mdd](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141524/http:/www.playtype.com/) font seems to   
at least be very close. I mean I can't really make out much detail from the   
e-types sample image provided, but letterforms seem to match up as   
best I can tell.   
   
Maybe it's actually way off ...   
   
Is it just me, or is that font navigation method rather unintuitive?
I was just going to say a word or two about [www.playtype.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141524/http:/www.playtype.com/) and their mdd, but Mike was faster...

I guess Mike and Jan got it.   
Just take a look at Nikolai's link (post #102), and   
you can see key characters like aring, oslash, etc.
Seems like Nicolai got it ... and didn't know it!

That sure looks like MDD...   
   
Thanks a lot for your help, I really appreciate it!   
  
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141524im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
